str2: Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
From the same as trope; a turn, i.e. mode or style; figuratively, deportment or character.
Sodom. Plural of Hebrew origin; Sodoma, a place in Palestine.
And, even, also, namely.
Gomorrah, one of the destroyed cities on the Dead Sea. Of Hebrew origin; Gomorrha, a place near the Dead Sea.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To be guilty of fornication. From ek and porneuo; to be utterly unchaste.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pro and keimai; to lie before the view, i.e. to be present, to stand forth.
An example, type; a thing shown. From the base of deiknuo; a specimen.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To submit to, undergo, suffer. From hupo and echo; to hold oneself under, i.e. Endure with patience.
Probably from deiknuo; right, i.e. Justice.
From aion; perpetual.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
